result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam D. Liebersbach was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Adam D. Liebersbach was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam D. Liebersbach in court with attorney Scott Harold Southworth.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Attorney Southworth gives status.  Count 1 & 3 of amended information.  Count 1 to misd. THC.  Received copy of amended information and waive reading.  Defendant agrees and understands.  State gives agreement reached.  Count 2 & 4 dismissed.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Southworth makes final statement.  Defendant makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
5 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Jail to commence on or before March 3, 2016 at 6:30 p.m.  Jail may be transferred to Juneau or Jackson County jail, per jail rules.   EMP approved, per court rules.  
Count 3:   
$1442.00 fine, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
$25 blood draw cost, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
10 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber (except first 48 hours), consecutive.  Jail to commence on or before March 3, 2016 at 6:30 p.m.  Jail may be transferred to Juneau or Jackson County jail, per jail rules.   EMP approved, per court rules.  
13 months Driver License revocation
AODA (Set up with Clerk of Court's office after court)
Ignition Interlock-13 months upon licensure.
Paperwork handed in court.
Final pre-trial at 01-04-2016 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 01-12-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Adam D. Liebersbach in court with attorney Scott Harold Southworth.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Officer Josh Hoege, Reedsburg Police, sworn & testifies as to incident in question.  Attorney Southworth interrupts and request sequestration.  State has no objection.  Court grants motion for sequestration.  State continue direct of Hoege.  Attorney Southworth cross examines.  Video (to be marked exh. 1) reviewed in court.  Officer questions re: video.  State objects to search warrant cross examination.  Court sustains.  Attorney Southworth continues cross examination.  State redirect of Officer Hoege.  Attorney Southworth calls Defendant, Adams David Liebersbach, sworn & testifies as to incident in question.  State cross examines.  Attorney Southworth redirect.  State recross.  Court request written argument.  Attorney Southworth request transcript.  20 days after transcript, 20 days for State and 10 day reply.  Court to issue decision after review.
